summary: This document is a daily lieutenant's log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, NY, covering three shifts on July 18, 2019. It details routine prison operations, inmate counts, and the status of specific inmates, including one on suicide watch and another at a nursing facility under USMS guard. The log reveals the prison's operational procedures and inmate management on a specific day.

persons.name: Sepiashvili
persons.context: Inmate #85956-054 who was taken to and returned from the local hospital (L-HOSP) during the Day Watch shift.

events.title: Daily Prison Operations Log
events.description: Routine log of the Metropolitan Correctional Center covering three shifts (Morning, Day, Evening Watch). Activities included inmate counts, body alarm tests, equipment checks, inmate movements to/from court and hospital, and a unit shakedown.

events.title: Inmate on Suicide Watch
events.description: Inmate #91268-054 was listed as being on suicide watch with an inmate companion across all three shifts documented in the log.

events.title: Inmate at Nursing Facility
events.description: Inmate #76254-054 was noted as being at a nursing facility (first 'Local Hospice', then 'Goldcrest nursing facility') under the guard of the United States Marshals Service (USMS).

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: The log records the operational status of the Metropolitan Correctional Center on July 18, 2019, showing routine counts, security checks, and inmate movements.
Inmate #91268-054 was on suicide watch with an inmate companion throughout the day.
Inmate #76254-054 was housed at an external nursing facility (Goldcrest) under US Marshals Service guard.
Inmate Sepiashvili (#85956-054) was taken to and returned from the local hospital during the Day Watch shift.
The log indicates various operational issues, including a malfunctioning public address system preventing PREA announcements and a malfunctioning sallyport door.
